definitions: a person who accepts a situation as it is and is prepared to deal with it accordingly

examples.text: I am a realist, with no time for your world of make believe

shortDefinitions: person who accepts situation as it is and is prepared to deal with it accordingly

definitions: a person who believes that the subject matter of politics is political power, not matters of principle

examples.text: the classical realist believes that the state is the most important actor in the international system

shortDefinitions: person who believes that subject matter of politics is political power

definitions: an artist or writer whose style is characterized by the representation of people or things as they actually are
shortDefinitions: artist or writer whose style is characterized by representation of people or things as they actually are

definitions: a person who believes in the theory of realism
shortDefinitions: person who believes in theory of realism

definitions: accepting a situation as it is and being prepared to deal with it accordingly

examples.text: a realist view of the world, its problems, and its future

shortDefinitions: accepting situation as it is and being prepared to deal with it accordingly

definitions: relating to or denoting the view that the subject matter of politics is political power, not matters of principle
shortDefinitions: relating to or denoting view that subject matter of politics is political power

definitions: representing a person or thing in a way that is accurate and true to life
shortDefinitions: representing person or thing in way that is true to life

definitions: relating to an artistic or literary movement or style characterized by the representation of people or things as they actually are
shortDefinitions: relating to artistic style representing things as they actually are

definitions: relating to or denoting the theory of realism
shortDefinitions: relating to or denoting theory of realism
